citation.article-title: Aureibacter tunicatorum gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from a coral reef sea squirt, and description of Flammeovirgaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Aureibacter (Au.re.i.bac′ter. L. adj. aureus golden; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Aureibacter golden rod).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-reaction-negative, aerobic and do not form endospores.
Nitrate and nitrite reduction are negative.
The major respiratory menaquinone is MK-7.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω5c.
The type species of the genus is Aureibacter tunicatorum.
